alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from these thunderstorms during the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours from these slow moving storms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then an Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lion Country Safari Park and Loxahatchee NWR. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
